title: Race for Treasury Committee chair decimated by Tory expulsions
text:
Big name candidates were conspicuous by their absence on the final shortlist to become chair of the powerful Treasury Select Committee in the wake of Boris Johnson’s recent purge of rebelling Conservative MPs.

The shortlist for the role heading up Westminster’s leading financial watchdog has previously attracted big hitters from the Conservatives but many of those linked to the coveted role have already been kicked out of the party.

Harriett Baldwin, Mark Garnier, Kevin Hollinrake and Mel Stride were named as the four MPs battling it out to head the most important backbencher group in Parliament yesterday afternoon. MPs will vote for the next chair on Wednesday.
description: Big name candidates were conspicuous by their absence on the final shortlist to become chair of the powerful Treasury Select Committee in the wake of Boris Johnson’s recent purge of rebelling Conservative MPs.
